Posts.Content: Canchaser wrote: Well, I finally have a plan. Port placement on Sept 21, then on to Abraxane and Avastin treatments. Three weeks on, one week off. What concerns me is the surgery that the breast surgeon wants to perform. I have a lesion on the bottom of my sternum, a mass growing in and out of the top of my sternum, and 1 node that is involved. Plan is to shrink the mass and then remove it surgically. It will be a major surgery. Siteman Cancer Center at Barnes in St. Loius does about 6 of these procedures a year. I trust my surgeon, but it just scares the crap out of me!!!  I am praying the chemo does its job and surgery will not be needed. Anyone have a procedure similar to this? Thanks all and hope all of your treatments are kicking the Cs butt!! Amy Dx 8/8/2011, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2011 07:49PM Canchaser wrote: Brenna, just let me say one thing, I HATE CANCER TOO! Guess that was really four things, but oh well. :O) I want you to know that I do the same thing. I look at people and think, "WOW" what a perfect cancer free life the are leading. I do double takes when I see women with short hair or ball caps. I was diagnosed in March of 2010 at age 36 with Stage I, had lumpectomy, chemo and radiation. BOOM, lump in sternum and Stage IV now. Just plain ole sucks!! But, I am determined to fight for my kids sake. If it was just me, I would probably say h*ll with it and let nature take its course. But, my 11 year old daughter and my 7 year old son are reasons to fight like the devil. Hugs to you! Amy
Posts.Title: I HATE BREAST CANCER Brenna-30yrsold-NYC FireKracker

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2011 04:51PM Canchaser wrote: I had 4 rounds of AC, 1 round of Taxol, and 3 rounds of Abraxane when I was diagnosed with Stage I in 2010. I did them every other week. AC was a Bitch! Had a reaction to Taxol and was switched to Abraxane. It was much much easier. Now I am doing Abraxane 3 weeks on and 1 week off. I also get Avastin or I was until the FDA did there thing. I believe Abraxane is easier having it each week. I had my 9th treatment last Monday. Can only say I have had 2 really bad days. Hope this info helped. Amy

However, he did say once the nodes near lung are clear, hormone treatment is still out there for me. Have a great day my friends! Amy

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2011 07:31PM Canchaser wrote: I have a single met to my sternum. I had a guided CT biopsy to confirm and to test for ER, PR, and HER2. I also had a Pet Scan, MRI, and CT scan. I am currently on abraxane and had 3 treatment of avastin. (insurance company is now balking on avastin) I may have surgery on my sternum if the tumor shrinks enough. (not 100% sold on surgery yet) Will know more after a CT scan on December 21. I would get a 2nd opinion. In my case I switched breast surgeons after a second opinion, and the oncologist that I recieved my second opinion  now works with my original oncologist regarding my treatment plan. Best of luck, Amy.
